The committeemen met him at the first door and, expressing their de- light at seeing such a highly honored guest, took possession of him as it were, without wait- ing for his reply, surrounded him, and led him to the drawing room. It was at first impos- sible to enter the drawing-room door for the crowd of members and guests jostling one an- other and trying to get a good look at Bagrati6n over each other's shoulders, as if he were some rare animal.
